intro: Carmichaelia astonii, commonly known as the Stewart Island kowhai, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a shrub-like appearance with compound leaves. Its flowers bloom in spring and are pollinated by native bees and birds. Carmichaelia astonii plays an important role in the ecological systems of its native habitat.
